channel.title: The newcomer experience
channel.description:
I have a few questions for anyone who may have used Whonix as their first distro (or at least gravitated to it early on when learning the ropes with Linux):
* How long ago was this and/or what build did you start on? * What was the experience like? * Were there any particular resources that you found helpful (documentation/videos etc)? * What sort of resources do you think might have assisted you better?
Thanks in advance for any responses :slightly_smiling_face:

item.title: The newcomer experience
item.dc:creator: PitchinPango
item.description:
Hi 0brand,

Thanks for the response! I enjoyed the trip down rookie memory lane, which I can certainly relate to!

I’ll be sure to further familiarise myself with the Wiki and the search engine during the coming weeks

Read full topic

item.title: The newcomer experience
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
Hi PitchinPango

Welcome to the Whonix community!!

I started out with Whonix 11/12 (or so).

What was my experience like? It was awesome! I’m here on the forum, testing Whonix and/or editing the Whonix wiki almost every day now. Like I said Awesome!!

I recently wrote about my first experience with Whonix which was also my first time using Linux.

http://forums.dds6qkxpwdeubwucdiaord2xgbbeyds25rbsgr73tbfpqpt4a6vjwsyd.onion/t/whonix-can-become-a-distribution-targeting-first-time-linux-users/7050/7

The Whonix Wiki is chalk full of great info. I would start from the beginning and read a little bit everyday . The forum search engine (upper right hand corner of your screen) is a great information resource as well.

Google Season of Docs will be winding up to the writing phase which should add much needed beginner documentation.

Whonix

Design/Google Season of Docs 2019

For the inaugural Season of Docs, we have some fun and exciting project ideas waiting for you. If you have an interest in working alongside top-notch ...

Read full topic
